intro: Euphrasia karataviensis, commonly known as Karatav Valley eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often branched. Euphrasia karataviensis is known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies for eye conditions.
